Name of District: Bhopal, Vidhisha, Sehore, Sagar, Hoshangabad, Raisen, Narsinghpur
Comments/ Action Taken: Cases of Zika virus disease were reported from multiple districts of Madhya Pradesh i.e. Bhopal (53), Vidhisha (50), Sehore (21), Sagar (2), Hoshangabad (2), Raisen (1), Narsinghpur (1). Central level, State level and District level RRT were constituted to investigate the outbreak. House to house fever survey was initiated around the affected areas. Fogging, larval control and personal protective measures were initiated in the area. A total of 486 blood samples were collected and tested at AIIMS Bhopal, of which 130 were found positive by RT-PCR. A 18 year old male tested positive for Zika and died of coinfection with Dengue and JE, similarly another women of 23 years tested positive and died of multiorgan failure.

Central level, State level and District level RRT were constituted to investigate the outbreak. House to house fever survey was initiated around the affected areas. Cases reported from CHC Puthenthope, Veli Poundukadavu, District Trivandrum. Case presented with fever, headache and conjunctival congestion followed by rash. Three samples collected and sent to MCH Trivandrum and other two at IAV Thonnakkal RT-PCR result for Zika Virus and Dengue virus found to be positive. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Other family members (wife and daughter) of the 38-year- old male case also showed similar symptoms, but their test results were negative for Zika virus. Out of the two antenatal cases residing in neighboring flats showed similar complaints, one came positive for Zika virus. She was 32-year-old female. Breeding site was found in indoor plants and some containers near the parking area. Adult Aedes Egypticus mosquitoes were identified and collected from inside the flat. Fogging and source reduction activities were performed. Community awareness and health education given peripheral health team on the importance of sanitation and vector control measures.

Case reported from Thiruvananthapuram. Case presented with symptoms of fever and rashes. Tested positive for ZIKA (RTPCR) at KIMS lab. She lives with her husband and 2-year-old child. None of them has symptoms currently. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Case is a 27-year-old antenatal (16 weeks) female who was diagnosed at KIMS hospital, Trivandrum.

Case was reported from Chembur West District Mumbai Suburban. He was admitted in Lal Dongar Dispensary. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Blood sample found positive for Zika Virus by RT-PCR testing at NIV Pune. Case was treated

Cases were reported from Kagwade Mal, District Kolhapur. Cases presented with fever. Total 95 blood samples sent to NIV Pune. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 3 samples came positive for Zika IgM by ELISA. Cases were treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Thalassery/ Pathiriyad (CT), Sub-District Thalassery, District Kannur. Cases presented with fever with rash, joint pain and redness of eyes. Total 13 blood samples were collected and sent to State PH lab Trivandrum further 28 samples were sent to for NIV, Alapuzha. 5 samples came positive for Zika virus by RT-PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on vector borne diseases. Health education imparted regarding the spread of disease.

Cases were reported from Sharda apartment, Nagala Park, Sub-District Karvir, District Kolhapur. Cases presented with fever. Total 461 blood samples were collected and sent to NIV Pune. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. 5 samples came positive for Zika Virus by RT- PCR. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Case was reported from Sub-District Nedumangad, District Thiruvananthapuram. A 36 year old male, presented with fever with rash. Serum sample was collected and sent to KIMS hospital. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated with supportive measures. Blood sample found positive for Zika virus by PCR. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Case reported from Thrikkadavoor, Sakthikulangara, Ward 3 (Arulappanthuruth) Kollam Corporation. Case presented with cough, headache and weakness. One blood sample was sent for lab analysis to IAV, Thonnakal and was found positive for Zika virus by RT-PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village- Koli Camp, PHC/CHC- Kallur, Taluk- Manvi, District- Raichur. Patient had history of Fever, vomiting, loose stools & headache. One blood and Urine sample collected and sent to RCVRDL, NIV Pune, which tested positive for zika virus. District and state RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Larva Survey, source reduction activity, fever surveillance, indoor fogging was done. Fever clinic opened in Anganwadi center.

Cases reported from Village Anayara, HSC Poonthura, PHC Kadakampalli, Block KIMS Hospital Trivandrum. Blood samples were collected and sent for lab analysis and they tested positive for Zika virus by PCR technique. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health Education was given.

Cases reported from Village Anayara, HSC Poonthura, PHC Kadakampalli, Block KIMS Hospital Trivandrum. Blood samples were collected and sent for lab analysis and they tested positive for Zika virus by PCR technique. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health Education was given.

Case reported from Malayidamthuruth, THQH Perumbavur, District-Ernakulam. Case presented with fever, head ache and rashes. One blood sample sent to NIV Alleppey for further lab analysis, the sample tested positive for Zika virus PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village Kapoorapur, CHC/Block/District Kannauj. District RRT investigated the outbreak. One urine sample was sent to KGMU, Lucknow and was found positive for Zika virus by IgM ELISA. 397 blood samples were collected and sent to Virology Lab, KGMU Lucknow following surveillance. Anti-larval spray was used and fogging done. Health education was given regarding importance of vector control measures.

Cases reported from Village Phoolbagh, UCHC Redcross, Sambalkhed near Phoenix Mall, Alambagh, Tola Mandir, Lalkuan, Sec F LDA Colony, LKW .5. Azad Nagar, District Lucknow. Six blood & six urine samples were collected and Virology Lab in KGMU, Lucknow. Of these, one urine sample was found positive for Zika virus. District RRT investigated the case. Health education was given.

Case reported from Village Trilokipur Fatehpur, PHC/Block Teliyani, District Fatehpur. 86 Serum and urine samples were sent to KGMU Lucknow, all were found to be negative. One sample was found positive for Zika virus by RT PCR test. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.
